articles.title: DPRK Foreign Ministry Spokesman Totally Rejects "Experts' Meeting" of Hostile Forces
articles.content:
DPRK Foreign Ministry Spokesman Totally Rejects "Experts' Meeting" of Hostile Forces
Pyongyang, September 23 (KCNA) -- A spokesman for the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of the DPRK released the following statement Wednesday:
					 The forces hostile toward the DPRK are trying hard to justify international cooperation for pressuring the DPRK by abusing the UN human rights arena as a theatre for "human rights" racket against the DPRK.
					
					 On the sideline of the 30th meeting of the UN Human Rights Council the U.S. and other hostile forces held what they called "experts' meeting" on the non-existent "human rights issue" in the DPRK where they cited the already-bankrupt anti-DPRK "investigation report" and "human rights resolution", finding fault with the DPRK and fanning up an international atmosphere critical of it.
					
					 The DPRK rejected the convention of the "meeting" itself and did not feel the need to take part in it from the beginning as it was clear that the anti-DPRK "human rights" campaign is aimed at "change of social system" and "replacement of regime".
					
					 But the DPRK took part in the "meeting" to reveal before the international community the truth about the enemies' anti-DPRK "human rights" racket as what would be mentioned at the "meeting" would be very provocative ones going beyond the tolerance limit.
					
					 As was anticipated, the "meeting" was proven again to be a sinister political farce aimed at "overthrowing the social system" of the DPRK under the pretext of human rights as it was a product of the U.S. hostile policy toward the DPRK.
					
					 Irony is that the U.S., chieftain of war of aggression and the biggest human rights abuser, took the lead in discussing someone's "human rights issue" while painting itself as an "advocate of human rights".
					
					 The U.S. is an evil empire getting engrossed in harassing peace and committing all sorts of human rights abuses not only inside the country but in all other parts of the world.
					
					 It is also the U.S. which caused the serious refugee issue sweeping the whole of Europe.
					
					 As the U.S. started wars in Afghanistan, Iraq, Libya, Syria and other parts of the world and fostered civil wars under the pretexts of "war on terrorism" and establishment of "democracy", refugees have been on sharp increase and there are increasing international voices blaming the U.S. for the refugee issue.
					
					 The recent "experts' meeting" glaringly revealed the clumsy nature of Japan and EU countries blindly obeying the U.S. for the sake of alliance, being indifferent to the encroachment upon the sovereignty of specified countries.
					
					 What should not be overlooked is the improper attitude of the UN Human Rights Council.
					
					 Far from taking issue with serious human rights abuses that have become the target of worldwide denunciation and censure, the UN Human Rights Council, siding with the U.S. hostile policy toward the DPRK, allowed itself to be used as leverage for putting pressure on specified countries. This abnormal development left the DPRK greatly skeptical about the principles of impartiality and strict neutrality touted by the body.
					
					 If such practices are continuously fostered and connived, the international human rights arena will become a political confrontation theatre for serving interests of individual countries, not one for realizing genuine dialogue and cooperation.
					
					 It is the consistent stand of the DPRK to wish for dialogue and cooperation for the protection and promotion of genuine human rights but to strongly reject dialogue and cooperation targeting sinister political purposes.
					
					 The DPRK bitterly denounces the anti-DPRK "human rights" campaign like the "experts' meeting" as an intolerable politically-motivated provocation and hardens its will to strongly counter the hostile forces' "human rights" racket to the last.
					
					 We will defend and further consolidate Korean-style socialist system, a cradle of a happy life of the Korean people, no matter what others may say.

articles.title: DPRK Red Cross Society Demands Immediate Halt to Moves to Enact "Law on Human Rights in North"
articles.content:
DPRK Red Cross Society Demands Immediate Halt to Moves to Enact "Law on Human Rights in North"
Pyongyang, September 23 (KCNA) -- The preparations for the reunion of divided families and relatives are now in full swing as the first step for implementing the hard-won agreement reached at the recent north-south high-level urgent contact.
					 A spokesman for the Central Committee of the Red Cross Society of the DPRK in a statement Wednesday slammed the south Korean ruling and opposition parties for moving to enact the "law on human rights in the north" at a session of the "National Assembly" against this backdrop. 
					
					 The statement branded this as an open provocation to reverse the trend of reconciliation and detente between the north and the south to confrontation and an outright challenge to the nation's desire for reunification.
					
					 The said move being pushed forward by the political philistines of south Korea with an aim to hurl mud at the dignified social system in the DPRK and genuine human rights of the people is a deliberate move to bedevil the north-south relations and derail the humanitarian exchange and cooperation between the fellow countrymen, it noted, and went on: 
					
					 This is an intolerable insult to ardent patriotism displayed by the DPRK and its positive efforts to alleviate the sufferings and pain of those who have been living separated from each other for such a long period. 
					
					 In fact, the Red Cross humanitarian issues including the reunion of separated families and relatives have not been properly settled because the U.S. and the south Korean anti-reunification forces have perpetrated vicious provocations whenever there was a sign of detente between the north and the south.
					
					 The statement expressed the expectation that the south Korea Red Cross, the International Red Cross and other humanitarian organizations and bodies would vehemently reject and denounce south Korea's reckless moves for the enactment of the "law on human rights in the north" that goes against the spirit of Red Cross and the idea of  humanitarianism.

articles.title: Icelandic President Hopes for Boosting Economic Cooperation with DPRK
articles.content:
Icelandic President Hopes for Boosting Economic Cooperation with DPRK
Pyongyang, September 23 (KCNA) -- DPRK Ambassador to Iceland Kang Yong Dok presented his credentials to President of Iceland Olafur Ragnar Grimsson on September 15. 
					 The Icelandic president hoped that economic cooperation between the two countries would be explored and developed in different fields.

articles.title: German Ambassador Gives Reception
articles.content:
German Ambassador Gives Reception
Pyongyang, September 23 (KCNA) -- German Ambassador to the DPRK Thomas Schaefer gave a reception at his embassy on Wednesday on the occasion of its national day.
					 Present there on invitation were Vice Foreign Minister Kung Sok Ung, officials concerned, diplomatic envoys and representatives of missions of the international organizations and staff members of foreign embassies here.

articles.title: Lao Embassy Officials Visit Junior Secondary School
articles.content:
Lao Embassy Officials Visit Junior Secondary School
Pyongyang, September 23 (KCNA) -- Lao Ambassador to the DPRK Phonekham Inthaboualy and his embassy officials Wednesday visited DPRK-Laos Friendship Chongryu Junior Secondary School in Taedonggang District on the occasion of the 70th anniversary of the founding of the Workers' Party of Korea.
					 The guests laid bouquets before the painting portraying images of President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il and paid tribute to them.
					
					 They looked round various places of the school.
					
					 They enjoyed an art performance given by schoolchildren.
					
					 The ambassador said he was pleased to visit the friendship school on the occasion of the 70th founding anniversary of the WPK.
					
					 The bilateral relations of friendship and cooperation provided by Comrade Kim Il Sung and Comrade Kaysone Phomvihane are growing stronger under the deep care of Comrade Kim Jong Un, the supreme leader of the Korean people, and Choummaly Saynasone, he added.
					
					 He wished the school will make positive contribution to developing the friendly and cooperative relations between Laos and the DPRK in the future, too.

articles.title: DPRK Strives to Improve Higher Education System
articles.content:
DPRK Strives to Improve Higher Education System
Pyongyang, September 23 (KCNA) -- A work has been conducted in the DPRK to readjust its higher education system under the Workers' Party of Korea's far-reaching plan for turning the country into a power of talents.
					 The Ministry of Higher Education under the Education Commission took steps for all universities and colleges to set in a scientific and realistic way their targets for training talents.
					
					 School system, faculties and chairs were readjusted at universities and colleges across the country and a new education program worked out. In the course there appeared a lot of new subjects, including subjects on ultra-modern science, at scores of universities.
					
					 Kim Il Sung University and Kim Chaek University of Technology developed in depth their education system in such a way as to help train academic and practical talents.
					
					 Meanwhile, regional and sectional universities were set up and colleges attached to some universities or turned into vocational schools. The study-while-working educational system grew in scale and the tele-education system run by major universities was expanded to give higher education to more working citizens.
					
					 Also a work goes on to readjust the system and structure for guiding educational administration.

articles.title: Sports Sci-tech Achievements Made in DPRK
articles.content:
Sports Sci-tech Achievements Made in DPRK
Pyongyang, September 23 (KCNA) -- Scientists and researchers of the DPRK have made sci-tech achievements conducive to turning the country into a sports power.
					 Teachers and researchers of Kim Il Sung University developed valuable programs for sports training. Among them are programs helpful to putting the training in events of gymnastics, football, marathon, weightlifting, shooting and boxing on a more scientific basis.
					
					 Those of Kim Chaek University of Technology completed aid systems for the training of paddlers and wrestlers on a higher level, while Pyongyang University of Computer Science developed a program helpful to working out a training plan according to the physical fitness of athletes.
					
					 Pyongyang Han Tok Su University of Light Industry established a method for designing and manufacturing sportswear suited to sportspersons' figures and athletic features and Korea University of Physical Education made it possible to put the guidance over training of weightlifters on a scientific and IT basis.
					
					 Scientists of the State Academy of Sciences developed a strength-measuring instrument helpful to evaluating sportspersons' capabilities and improved indoor athletic training aids.

articles.title: Japan Slammed for Trying to Make Korean Peninsula Theatre of War
articles.content:
Japan Slammed for Trying to Make Korean Peninsula Theatre of War
Pyongyang, September 23 (KCNA) -- At least 120 national organizations of south Korea including the Council for the Peaceful Unification of Tangun's Nation held a press conference on Sept. 21 at which they demanded the cancellation of Japan's "security bills", according to CBS of south Korea.
					 Speakers said that Japan is becoming ever more pronounced in its moves for reviving militarism, far from making an apology for its past crimes.
					
					 The Korean Peninsula is the area of the biggest possibility for putting the "right to collective self-defense" into practice, they said, demanding Japan repeal the dangerous law at once.
					
					 They bitterly lambasted Japan for trying to make the Korean Peninsula a theatre of war and the U.S. for instigating such move.

articles.title: Overseas Koreans Organization Accuses U.S. of Interfering in Internal Issue of Korean Nation
articles.content:
Overseas Koreans Organization Accuses U.S. of Interfering in Internal Issue of Korean Nation
Pyongyang, September 23 (KCNA) -- The Regional Committee of the Commonwealth of Independent States of the Pan-national Alliance for Korea's Reunification made public a statement on Sept. 19 denouncing the U.S. for laying obstacles in the way of improving the north-south relations.
					 The base moves of the U.S. chilling the atmosphere of mending the inter-Korean relations and escalating the tension on the Korean Peninsula are sparking off bitter resentment of Koreans, the statement said, and went on:
					
					 If the U.S. interference and obstructions are left intact, the north-south relations can never be mended.
					
					 The Regional Committee of the Commonwealth of Independent States of the Pan-national Alliance for Korea's Reunification strongly condemns the U.S. moves against the DPRK and demands the U.S. forces be withdrawn from south Korea at once.
					
					 The south Korean authorities should stop at once the foolish act of endangering the inter-Korean relations and laying obstacles in the way of implementing the agreement through confrontation racket contrary to the desire of all Koreans.

articles.title: Chongryon Officials Condemn U.S. and Its Followers for Chilling Atmosphere of Mending Inter-Korean Relations
articles.content:
Chongryon Officials Condemn U.S. and Its Followers for Chilling Atmosphere of Mending Inter-Korean Relations
Tokyo, September 22 (KNS-KCNA) -- Officials of headquarters of the General Association of Korean Residents in Japan (Chongryon) issued statements on Sept. 19 condemning the U.S. and its followers for chilling the atmosphere of improving the north-south relations.
					 Hwang Myong, chairman of the Tokyo Metropolitan Headquarters of Chongryon, said whenever an atmosphere of improving the north-south relations was created, the U.S. prodded the south Korean authorities into deliberately chilling it.
					
					 Pu Yong Uk, chairperson of the Osaka Prefectural Headquarters of Chongryon, underlined the need to thoroughly smash the U.S. interference and obstructions to improving the inter-Korean relations.
					
					 Kim Sang Il, chairman of the Kyoto Prefectural Headquarters of Chongryon, said the U.S. is the chieftain of the division of the Korean nation and a cancer-like entity which has persistently sought escalation of tension and confrontation only on the Korean Peninsula in a bid to permanently occupy south Korea.
					
					 So Chun Won, chairperson of the Aichi Prefectural Headquarters of Chongryon, noted that the U.S. is making desperate efforts to build up a negative opinion about the DPRK and drive a wedge between the north and the south.

articles.title: Endless Stream of People Visit Sonbong Revolutionary Site
articles.content:
Endless Stream of People Visit Sonbong Revolutionary Site
Sonbong, September 22 (KCNA) -- An endless stream of people  are  visiting  the Sonbong Revolutionary Site, expressing deep reverence for anti-Japanese war hero Kim Jong Suk.
					 Service personnel and hundreds of thousands of people and school youth and children of more than 3 780 units visited the site over the past decade.
					
					 The site is associated with undying revolutionary feats Kim Jong Suk performed by visiting it together with leader Kim Jong Il late in  November, Juche 34 (1945) to powerfully arouse people of all social standings to build a new country.
					
					 The visitors laid bouquets before the mosaic portraying the peerlessly great persons before paying tribute to them.
					
					 They went round Tongsonbong Hill where Kim Jong Suk instilled ardent patriotism into the mind of Kim Jong Il and called upon students to become good pillars of the country true to the intention of President Kim Il Sung, a place where she had a talk with students and Junghyon Hill.
					
					 Going round a house of her comrade-in-arms used by her as lodging house and a house of a peasant where she took warm care of his living, the visitors deeply grasped the undying feats she performed by arousing the people to carry out the line of building a new country.

articles.title: "Law on Human Rights in North" Will Do Harm to North-South Relations: KCNA Commentary
articles.content:
"Law on Human Rights in North" Will Do Harm to North-South Relations: KCNA Commentary
Pyongyang, September 23 (KCNA) -- The south Korean conservative forces are moving to pass the "bill on human rights in the north" through the "National Assembly" session.
					 The conservative forces including those of the "Saenuri Party" are busy with their moves to railroad the bill that has been kept outstanding at the NA for more than a decade, under the pretext of "protecting and promoting human rights of north Korean inhabitants".
					
					 There is a question why they are in a hurry for the enactment of the "law on human rights in the north" at this moment.
					
					 Now is the most sensitive time for the improvement of the north-south relations and the "law on human rights in the north" is considered to be the most serious declaration of confrontation between social systems.
					
					 All the Koreans are looking forward to seeing the north-south relations developing in the direction of dialogue, cooperation and peace in the spirit of the agreement reached at the north-south high-level urgent contact.
					
					 Moreover, the reunion of separated families and relatives is high on the agenda thanks to the north-south Red Cross working contact, and the talks between the authorities between the north and the south are also expected.
					
					 The conservative forces of south Korea are getting zealous for the adoption of the hackneyed law, quite contrary to the atmosphere of dialogue against this backdrop. Is it not a revelation of their displeasure about this atmosphere or intention to disturb it?
					
					 The "bill on human rights in the north" is peppered with poisonous articles reflecting inveterate repugnancy towards the DPRK and those slinging mud at it and "overthrowing its social system".
					
					 If the confrontation between the fellow countrymen is fixed by law through the adoption of the "law", the atmosphere of improving the north-south relations will be iced overnight, driving them into the worst phase of confrontation.
					
					 The south Korean ultra-right conservative forces displeased with the atmosphere of improving the north-south relations are seeking to torpedo the efforts for it by adopting the law, timed to coincide with the U.S. and other hostile forces' "human rights" racket against the DPRK.
					
					 As well known, "human rights" issue touted by the hostile forces does not exist under the socialist system centered on the popular masses in our country chosen and protected by themselves.
					
					 The anti-DPRK "human rights" racket is a stumbling block lying in the way of achieving national reconciliation and unity and improving the north-south relations as it is a negation of the ideology, social system and dignity of the DPRK.
					
					 All the dishonest moves of the south Korean conservative forces aimed to do harm to the ideology and social system of the DPRK with hostility toward them have blocked the implementation of the north-south agreements and thrown the bilateral relations into the mire of confrontation. This is a lesson taught by history.
					
					 The south Korean authorities would be well advised to immediately stop the good-for-nothing moves for adopting the above-said law.

articles.title: Cooperation with Outside Forces Is Obstacle to Improving Inter-Korean Relations: Rodong Sinmun
articles.content:
Cooperation with Outside Forces Is Obstacle to Improving Inter-Korean Relations: Rodong Sinmun
Pyongyang, September 23 (KCNA) -- The south Korean authorities pay lip-service to the implementation of the agreement and thumb their nose at the dialogue partner through cooperation with outside forces.
					 Rodong Sinmun Wednesday says in an article in this regard:
					
					 The south Korean authorities have boosted cooperation with the U.S. in the nuclear racket against the DPRK under the pretext of the "settlement of nuclear issue".
					
					 Outside forces are working hard to seize the Korean Peninsula which is called a gateway to Northeast Asia and located in a geopolitically important region.
					
					 It is the sinister intention of the U.S. to occupy the whole of Korea with south Korea as a springboard and carry out the strategy for dominating Asia.
					
					 The U.S. does not want to see the improved relations between the north and the south and Korea's reunification but is keen to isolate and stifle the DPRK.
					
					 Reliance upon outside forces, the chief architect of the nation's division and disturber of reunification, will not help improve the north-south relations and will escalate the confrontation with compatriots.
					
					 This being a hard reality, the south Korean authorities persist in depending on outside forces and cooperating with them in confrontation with the DPRK. This is an act of treachery as it makes the inter-Korean relations a scapegoat of outside forces though they narrowly weathered a crisis.
					
					 The north and the south should independently solve all problems while rejecting outside forces.
					
					 Only when they adhere to the principle of independence, can they overcome all difficulties and make their dialogue successful and mend their relations on the basis of trust.

articles.title: Denuclearization of World Is Armchair Argument as Long as U.S. Exists: Rodong Sinmun
articles.content:
Denuclearization of World Is Armchair Argument as Long as U.S. Exists: Rodong Sinmun
Pyongyang, September 23 (KCNA) -- U.S. President Obama loudly cried out for building a "world without nuclear weapons" in the early days of his office. He even bragged he would give a continued push to it during his office even though it may not bear a fruit.
					 Commenting on this, Rodong Sinmun Wednesday in an article says toward the end of his tenure human existence has faced more serious threat in different parts of the world due to the U.S. undisguised nuclear war moves.
					
					 The world people drew a conclusion once again that as long as the U.S. posing the  biggest nuclear threat to mankind after deploying huge nuclear weapons around the world, remains in the world, the denuclearization of the world would be nothing but a armchair argument, the article says, and goes on:
					
					 What matters is that the U.S. is trumpeting about the "world without nuclear weapons" while persisting in nuclear threat and blackmail against other countries. Under such situation a denuclearized world can never appear.
					
					 The U.S. initiative for building a "world without nuclear weapons" is no more than a political chicanery for deceiving other countries and misleading world public opinion. 
					
					 The building of a denuclearized world is a long way off due to the nuclear maniacs seeking hegemony with nuclear stick.
					
					 A commitment to building the denuclearized world does not mean its realization.

articles.title: U.S. Is Not Entitled to Interfere in Issue of North-South Relations: Rodong Sinmun
articles.content:
U.S. Is Not Entitled to Interfere in Issue of North-South Relations: Rodong Sinmun
Pyongyang, September 23 (KCNA) -- Those concerned of the White House, the U.S. State Department and Defense Department and the so-called north Korean experts vied one another to grumble that "north Korea has reneged on its promise more than once and that at the talks between Obama and the south Korean chief executive the north's nuclear issue and 'human rights' issue are to be dealt seriously" in a bid to drive a wedge in the relations between the north and the south. In the meantime, they are mulling hurling special warfare troops of the U.S. Army into south Korea from their mainland under the pretext of the "north's provocation".
					 A commentary of Rodong Sinmun Wednesday says that this is a deliberate anti-reunification move to hobble the DPRK's efforts for defusing mistrust and contradiction between the north and the south and improving the relations by their concerted efforts, build up ill public opinion and egg the south Korean authorities on to fan up confrontation with fellow countrymen.
					
					 Saying that the U.S. is not entitled to interfere in the issue of relations between the north and the south, the commentary goes on:
					
					 The U.S. speaks loudly of its "support" for the improvement of the north-south relations but it is just a chicanery to conceal its dirty intention and justify its hostile policy toward the DPRK. When the north-south high-level urgent contact was in progress and the joint press release was made public, the U.S., hardly concealing its disturbed feelings, galvanized the public opinion with such story as "the north's long-range missile threat" and "possible provocation in October". This clearly proves its dirty nature.
					
					 The situation proves that the U.S. persistently seeks to isolate and stifle the DPRK through cooperation in the moves for escalating the confrontation with the DPRK while keeping the south Korean authorities from coming out for the improvement of the relations with the north under the plea of "alliance".

articles.title: S. Korean Organization Flays Japan's Moves for Militarization
articles.content:
S. Korean Organization Flays Japan's Moves for Militarization
Pyongyang, September 23 (KCNA) -- The Citizens Solidarity for Democratic Society in south Korea released a statement on Sept. 18 denouncing Japan's moves for militarization aimed at threatening peace.
					 Recalling that the security bills were railroaded through the special committee of the House of Councillors of Japan, the statement said that the passage of the bills means war criminal state Japan's act of breaking the promise made with the international community in violation of the Pacifist Constitution which calls for renouncing war, not recognizing the right to belligerency and not possessing an army.
					
					 The statement said if Japan neutralizes the Pacifist Constitution and opts for rearming and turning itself into a military giant, the peace and security in Northeast Asia will be exposed to big threats.
					
					 It demanded the Japanese government and the Diet not defy the demands of the public at home and abroad any longer but immediately retract the security bills.

articles.title: Bird Flu Spreads in Different Areas of South Korea
articles.content:
Bird Flu Spreads in Different Areas of South Korea
Pyongyang, September 23 (KCNA) -- Bird flu spread in Kwangju and South Jolla Province, south Korea, according to KBS of south Korea.
					 The Ministry of Agro-Forestry, Livestock and Foodstuff said that bird flu virus was detected in the excretion of ducks at markets in Kwangju area and Tamyang, South Jolla Province.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il's Work Introduced by British Organization
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il's Work Introduced by British Organization
Pyongyang, September 23 (KCNA) -- The full text of leader Kim Jong Il's work "The Workers' Party of Korea Is the Party of the Great Leader Comrade Kim Il Sung" was posted on its homepage by the British Association for the Study of Songun Policy on the occasion of the 70th anniversary of the founding of the Workers' Party of Korea (WPK).
					 The work, published on October 2, Juche 84 (1995), serves as a great program for the party building and activities as it reviews with pride the glorious history of the WPK that paved a new way of building a revolutionary party in the era of independence under the leadership of President Kim Il Sung, and indicates the way for developing the WPK into the eternal party of the President.

articles.title: Kim Jong Suk Pyongyang Textile Mill Introduced in Nigeria
articles.content:
Kim Jong Suk Pyongyang Textile Mill Introduced in Nigeria
Pyongyang, September 23 (KCNA) -- The Nigerian National Committee for the Study of Kimilsungism-Kimjongilism on September 16 posted on its website an article titled "Kim Jong Suk Pyongyang Textile Mill."
					 The article said:
					
					 There are not a few units named after anti-Japanese war hero Kim Jong Suk in the DPRK.
					
					 Among them is Kim Jong Suk Pyongyang Textile Mill situated on the bank of the Taedong River in Pyongyang.
					
					 Kim Jong Suk came out to the spot accompanying President Kim Il Sung on October 10, 1948.
					
					 She said that the site chosen by the President for building a mill was a good place, adding that the construction of a big textile mill would help translate into reality her lifetime desire to provide the people, once ill-clad and poor, with nice clothes.
					
					 Her noble desire came true thanks to the wise leadership of the President and Kim Jong Il, chairman of the National Defence Commission.
					
					 Marshal Kim Jong Un visited the mill in October, 2013 and said that it was the intention of the Workers' Party of Korea to put equipment of the mill on a high- speed basis and update its production processes at a high level so as to increase the production of good-quality clothing materials  and varieties of textiles.
					
					 He showed such loving care as making sure that a new workers' hostel was built to meet the requirements of a highly civilized socialist nation so that the workers of the mill playing a big role in the nation's textile production might have good living conditions.

articles.title: Romanian Preparatory Committee for Celebrating WPK's Birthday Formed
articles.content:
Romanian Preparatory Committee for Celebrating WPK's Birthday Formed
Pyongyang, September 23 (KCNA) -- A Romanian preparatory committee for celebrating the 70th founding anniversary of the Workers' Party of Korea was formed on September 15. 
					 Vasile Orleanu, chairman of the Romanian National Committee for the Study of the Juche Idea, was elected chairman of the preparatory committee. 
					
					 The preparatory committee decided to hold political and cultural events including a seminar, lecture and film show in the capital and local areas from September 20 to October 10.

articles.title: Slovak Preparatory Committee for Celebrating WPK's Birthday Formed
articles.content:
Slovak Preparatory Committee for Celebrating WPK's Birthday Formed
Pyongyang, September 23 (KCNA) -- A Slovak preparatory committee for celebrating the 70th founding anniversary of the Workers' Party of Korea was formed in Bratislava on September 19. 
					 Ivan Draxler, chairman of the Slovak Association for Supporting the Juche Idea, was elected chairman of the preparatory committee. 
					
					 The preparatory committee decided to hold colorful political and cultural events in praise of the revolutionary careers of President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il and the exploits of Marshal Kim Jong Un on the anniversary.

articles.title: S. Korean Authorities Flailed for Slandering Dialogue Partner: Koreans in Kyrgyzstan
articles.content:
S. Korean Authorities Flailed for Slandering Dialogue Partner: Koreans in Kyrgyzstan
Pyongyang, September 23 (KCNA) -- The United Confederation of Koreans in Kyrgyzstan issued a statement on Sept. 20 condemning the south Korean authorities for laying obstacles in the way of improving the north-south relations.
					 If the south Korean authorities truly want peace and improvement of the relations between the north and the south, they should stop at once all acts of slandering and irritating the dialogue partner, the statement said.
					
					 They should also abandon ambition to cooperate with foreign forces over the issue of national reunification, the internal issue of the Korean nation, it noted.

articles.title: "Ley de DDHH del Norte" es inutil al desarrollo de relaciones N-S, apunta ACNC
articles.content:
"Ley de DDHH del Norte" es inutil al desarrollo de relaciones N-S, apunta ACNC
Pyongyang, 23 de septiembre (ACNC) -- El "Partido Saenuri" y otras fuerzas conservadoras surcoreanas pretenden aprobar la "ley de DDHH del Norte" sometida durante mas de 10 anos a la consideracion de la "Asamblea Nacional" so pretexto de "la proteccion y fomento de derechos humanos de la poblacion norcoreana". 
					Esta ley resulta la mas grave declaracion de enfrentamiento de sistemas. 
					
					Toda la nacion coreana desea tanto el desarrollo de las relaciones intercoreanas con rumbo al dialogo, la cooperacion y la paz a base del espiritu del acuerdo del contacto urgente de alto nivel Norte-Sur. 
					
					En particular, en visperas del encuentro de familiares y parientes separados y las conversaciones de autoridades Norte-Sur, las fuerzas conservadoras surcoreanas se desesperan por la aprobacion de la anticuada "ley de DDHH del Norte", a contrapelo del ambiente favorable al dialogo. 
					
					Los contenidos de la ley en cuestion estan llenos del veto y las calumnias a la RPDC persiguiendo el "derrocamiento del regimen norcoreano".
					
					En el caso de aprobarse la "ley de DDHH del Norte", se cambiara el ambiente de la mejora de las relaciones intercoreanas y se encontraran esos vinculos en la coyuntura de enfrentamiento irremediable.
					
					En fin de cuentas, los conservadores ultraderechistas surcoreanos intentan fabricar a toda costa la "ley de DDHH del Norte" en adhesion a la campana de "DDHH" anti-RPDC de EE.UU. y otras fuerzas hostiles para impedir el desarrollo de las relaciones intercoreanas. 
					
					Como es conocido por todo el mundo, en nuestro regimen socialista centrado en las masas populares, optado y defendido por el pueblo coreano, no existe nada el problema de "DDHH" de que hablan las fuerzas hostiles. 
					
					La campana de "DDHH" anti-RPDC es la negacion a la ideologia, regimen y dignidad de la RPDC y obstaculiza la reconciliacion y unidad nacionales y la mejora de las relaciones intercoreanas. 
					
					Historicamente, las fuerzas conservadoras surcoreanas que hostilizan la ideologia y el regimen de la parte connacional vinieron impidiendo la ejecucion de los acuerdos N-S y llevando a la ruptura las relaciones intercoreanas. 
					
					Las autoridades surcoreanas deben abandonar el intento de aprobar la "ley de DDHH del Norte" danina al desarrollo de las relaciones intercoreanas.

articles.title: Portavoz de ACRC condena maniobras de fabricacion de "ley de DDHH del Norte"
articles.content:
Portavoz de ACRC condena maniobras de fabricacion de "ley de DDHH del Norte"
Pyongyang, 23 de septiembre (ACNC) -- Ahora, el Norte y el Sur de Corea impulsan en gran escala los preparativos por el encuentro de familiares y parientes separados como primer paso de la ejecucion del acuerdo del contacto urgente de alto nivel Norte-Sur de Corea preparado a duras penas.
					Pero, los partidos en el poder y opositores surcoreanos maniobran con frenesi por aprobar la "ley de derechos humanos del Norte" en la "Asamblea Nacional".
					
					Esto deviene la provocacion abierta tendente a revolver a la confrontacion la corriente de la reconciliacion y relajacion entre el Norte y el Sur de Corea y el desafio frontal a la aspiracion de reunificacion de la nacion.
					
					Asi senala el portavoz del Comite Central de la Asociacion de la Cruz Roja de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea en su declaracion publicada el dia 23 y prosigue:
					
					La farsa de fabricacion de la "ley de DDHH del Norte" de los politiqueros surcoreanos encaminada a calumniar con el atroz metodo intrigante el digno regimen de la RPDC y los derechos humanos verdaderos del pueblo coreano es la maniobra intencional para interrumpir las relaciones Norte-Sur y frustrar hasta el intercambio humanitario y las labores de cooperacion entre los connacionales.
					
					Igualmente, deviene el insulto intolerable al amor a la nacion y los esfuerzos activos de la RPDC por aliviar el sufrimiento y la pena de los familiares y los parientes quienes viven por separado durante largo tiempo.
					
					Hasta ahora no se resuelve exitosamente el problema humanitario de la Cruz Roja incluyendo el encuentro de familiares y parientes separados, lo cual se debe a los actos provocativos atroces de las fuerzas anti-reunificacion de Estados Unidos y el Sur de Corea que se han cometido cada vez que se aparecia un indicio de relajacion de situacion entre el Norte y el Sur de Corea.
					
					La ACR de la RPDC expresa la esperanza de que la Sociedad de la Cruz Roja del Sur de Corea y las organizaciones y entidades internacionales de la Cruz Roja y humanitarias denuncien y rechacen rotundamente las maniobras de invencion de la ley arriba mencionada contrarias al espiritu de la Cruz Roja y el ideal humanitario que se desarrollan imprudentemente en el Sur de Corea.
